HPI 8450 Nissan Skyline GT-R 1993 Fuji 6H WinnerM. Kageyama



The 1993 JGTC season was the inaugural season of the All-Japan Grand Touring Car Championship. It was the successor to the All Japan Sports Prototype Car (JSPC) Endurance Championship, as international prototypes were in a state of flux in the early 1990's, and sportscar racing globally had switched from prototypes to grand tourers.

The championship was contested over 4 rounds and was won by Masahiko Kageyama in the #2 NISMO Skyline GT-R. Kageyama won rounds 1, 2, and 4 competing against other Skylines, Silvias, and RX-7s. Round 3 was an endurance race - Suzuka 1000km - where the Nissan R92CP and other Group C cars were dominant.

This is Kageyama's winning car from Round 2, the Fuji 6 Hours race.
